page.title: 01General Survey
page.content: This is an area of lowland, drained by the little River Leadon and a few minor brooks, with Limbury Hill on the southern edge of the area the only eminence, rising to some 40 metres only. It is part of the parishes of {Upleadon}and{Corse,}containing both those parish churches, but the villages they serve are outside the survey area, so apart from an extension of Hartbury in the south- east corner and some development along the A417 this is a district of scattered farms and other homes. A questionaire delivered in the area produced 33 returns, representing under 30% of the area's residences. Information gained from this limited sample showed the following facts:- {16 adults were born locally while{38 have moved into the area within the last 20 years.
